project.teaser: The FINEST SCALEUP project brings together leading research and innovation actors to establish the Baltic Sear Region countries: Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Finland and Poland, onwards referred to as the ‘BSR-5’, as a cross-border, inclusive and gender equal Deep tech...
project.objective:
The FINEST SCALEUP project brings together leading research and innovation actors to establish the Baltic Sear Region countries: Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Finland and Poland, onwards referred to as the ‘BSR-5’, as a cross-border, inclusive and gender equal Deep tech innovation ecosystem with the main goal to support companies, start-ups and entrepreneurs to showcase innovative technologies, attract investment and reach global markets.
The FINEST SCALEUP addresses the lack of scale-up funding for startups from 'Less Connected and Developing Innovation Ecosystems', particularly those women-led and from the Deep tech sector .
It leverages on the FinEst Centre, as a world-class Centre of Excellence for Smart Cities Research and Innovation, has developed a cross-border knowledge transfer infrastructure (Urban Operating Platform) that supports its piloting programme, with a combined 100M€ budget to invest in research heavy solutions that have a strong potential to develop into deep tech companies. In the FINEST SCALEUP project, the FinEst Centre capitalises on Finnish-Estonian macro region’s scientific and empirical knowledge to build and strengthen the innovation potential of gender neutral deep tech entrepreneurship across the BSR-5.
project.title: Elevating the scalability potential of EU Smart Cities’ business for green and sustainable deep tech based solutions

article.title: Inclusive and gender-equal deep tech innovation ecosystem for the Baltic Sea Region

result.title: Gender Action Plan (v.2)
result.description: The Gender Action Plan - GAP (D2.1) - update 1 - Is intended to provide a framework to maximise and closely monitor to the gender dimension (i) within the consortium, (ii) across our coordination and support activities, and (iii) in the wider context of the FINEST SCALEUP project innovation ecosystem and deep tech domains.

result.title: FINEST SCALEUP toolkit digital platform and info point helpdesk
result.description: FINEST SCALEUP toolkit and digital platform (D3.2) which will support all targeted stakeholders, consisting of interactive tools and links to various types of assistance points, including an centralised digital helpdesk/info point, which will continue to be developed over the project lifetime

result.title: CED Toolkit
result.description: CED tools: webpage, social media pages, graphical charts and templates, visual identity to launch communication campaigns and within the community is named CED Toolkit (D8.2).

result.title: Repository of innovation ecosystems best practices
result.description: Repository of best practices of market entry facilitation for international investors.

result.title: Gender Action Plan
result.description: The Gender Action Plan - GAP (D2.1),is intended to provide a framework to maximise and closely monitor to the gender dimension (i) within the consortium, (ii) across our coordination and support activities, and (iii) in the wider context of the FINEST SCALEUP project innovation ecosystem and deep tech domains. It will be regularly updated. Foreseen updates in M12 and M21.

result.title: Exploitation, Replicability and Sustainability Plan
result.description: FINEST SCALEUP project Exploitation, Replicability and Sustainability (ER&S) Plan (D8.3) goal is to pave the way for the adoption of its results by the ‘LC&D.IE’ stakeholders, and beyond, during and after the end of the project. The ER&S plan, first version to be prepared by M6 and a final mature version by M27 (a few months before the project completion, in order to absorb the learning and project results, and to support the final stage of results dissemination and exploitation, and solidify the impact pathways after the project completion)

result.title: Digital orientation programme for investors
result.description: A digital orientation programme is to be made available (D5.1) building on the best practices repository, toolkits, info points and services. It will be upgraded in order to adapt to the investors needs as they get familiarised with the ecosystems.

result.title: Consolidated access to existing peer-matching tools
result.description: This Deliverable has been tentative created during the GAP, so to comply with the request to have at least 1 deliverable per WP.However, we deem this deliverable as unnecessary as it is covered by the project milestones (MS4, MS5, MS6). Focus: the project digital platform will provide consolidated access to existing peer-matching tools and databases in support of the startups and investors matchmaking and dealmaking support.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
